titles.title: Commercial Real Estate and Economic Development Act of 2015
CREED Act of 2015
Commercial Real Estate and Economic Development Act of 2015
CREED Act of 2015
A bill to extend the low-interest refinancing provisions under the Local Development Business Loan Program of the Small Business Administration.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

calendar.text: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship. Reported by Senator Vitter with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 107.

bill.summary:
6/10/2015--Reported to Senate amended. Commercial Real Estate and Economic Development Act of 2015 or the CREED Act of 2015
(Sec. 2) Reinstates the authority for Small Business Administration (SBA) low-interest refinancing of small business debt not involving business expansion under the SBA's local development business loan program, effective:
on and after enactment of this Act, and during any fiscal year in which the federal government's cost in making loan guarantees under such program is zero. Repeals a provision of the Small Business Jobs Act of 2010 that terminated such authority as of September 27, 2012.
